intro: Haplopappus densifolius, commonly known as the thickleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Haplopappus densifolius is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub ecosystems.
